hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1321 a and today's date is July
2nd 2017 and the top of the episode is
economic alert it has begun the collapse
a spreading state-by-state now before I
get started I just want to make an
announcement on Saturday I uploaded an
interview with V the gorilla economist
and CJ the producer it is on the x-22
report spotlight YouTube channel so if
you go over to YouTube and you type in X
20 to report spotlight it will bring you
to that video or you can come over to
the X 20 to report calm sight or the new
Sentinel dot-com site scroll down a
little bit look over the right-hand side
you'll see the video there and you can
play it right on the site or you can go
to steam it which is steam it dot-com
forward slash at X 20 to report it will
bring you right to the video and you can
watch the video right on Stephen let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now we understand right now that
retail is having a major problem I mean
we're seeing a retail apocalypse and we
knew this was coming because we've been
tracking this for a very long time and
of course the corporate media the Fed
the government they were all out there
telling us that it was the weather and
there are other factors that were
causing this problem when we started to
look at it and we looked deeply into it
we realized that well people weren't
working people didn't have discretionary
funds people didn't have that extra
money to go out and purchase the goods
it had nothing to do with online had
nothing to do with the weather it had to
do with what was going on in the economy
and we need to remember something very
important right now and this is coming
out of a retail consultancy
Alex Partners where they looked at
retail especially the food industry and
a lot of the supermarket's
a lot of the retail chains like Walmart
Target and others well they've been
propped up by the food stamp system now
think about this for a second there has
been an incredible increase since the
Great Recession on the individuals that
are on food stamps now the
even these individuals needed to go on
food stamps is because the system that
we are in today does not produce jobs
does not produce the jobs we can go out
and make a living and you're getting
that full-time high paying job we know
that manufacturing has been decreasing
or no it we know now that retail a lot
of the corporate high-level jobs they've
been laying off we know that the low
lower part-time jobs they've been laying
off and right now these unemployment
numbers they're completely fake phony
and false they're manipulated to make us
think that the employment sector is
doing very well but a lot of people have
one or two or three part-time jobs and
they're still not making the same as
they were before and there's a lot of
people that can't even find any type of
work and they resort to food stamps to
help them get by and we need to
understand because of the way the system
is designed the way the system is
operating right now there's no
alternative but for the government to
step in this is how it was designed now
a lot of this money has been going to
support the supermarkets been going to
support the chains now if we break it
down we can see that Walmart for
instance well they take in around twelve
point seven billion dollars now think
about this if there was no food stamp
program and these individuals were out
of work they couldn't find work or they
have a part-time job these retail stores
would collapse what's keeping them
pretty much alive right now
is the food stamp industry which means
the tax payers are paying for all this
for these corporations to stay in
business and I'm not knocking the people
that are on food stamps they many of the
people today who can't find jobs or only
have a part-time job who have families
this is the only way they can survive I
understand this we all understand this
because the system right now is not
designed to create incredible jobs think
about all the manufacturing jobs we've
lost look at all the jobs that are being
lost right now in the retail industry in
the corporate arena it's getting worse
if we look at target they receive
between four point eight billion and
five point three billion dollars worth
of food stamp sales and what's going to
happen as we move forward as things
start to break down and we already know
that there's going to be cuts in this
area because a lot of the government
programs there's going to be many many
cuts because the government is broke
we're going to have a major major
problem in the retail industry forget
about online forget about all this
brick-and-mortar stores the entire
retail industry is going to take a huge
hit because when the system starts to
really completely break apart like we're
seeing right now we're going to see
things really accelerate and remember
everything is intertwined right now we
know the government you know provides
subsidies for many businesses they're
blaming if we look at food stamps we can
see this is really like a subsidy for
these businesses to operate if we remove
this billions and billions and billions
of dollars and people can't find jobs
these businesses will not be able to
survive either so we're going to see a
catastrophic event hit I mean we're
already starting to see it in many many
states Maine Connecticut Illinois New
Jersey we're starting to see the whole
thing completely fall apart and there's
like another ten states that are right
on the precipice of completely imploding
on themselves and when we look at
Illinois we can see they are in a huge
amount of trouble right now and we know
that the lawmakers in Illinois well they
fail to agree on how to compromise all
the government's deficits and we could
see right now they're very close to a
junk rated US state a federal judge Joan
left count in Chicago ordered Illinois
to come up with hundreds of millions of
dollars it owes in Medicaid payments
that state officials say the government
just doesn't have and judge Lefko
ordered the state to make 586 million in
monthly payments as well as another two
billion towards a thrilled three billion
backlog of payments right now the
general funds payable backlog is what 14
billion dollars approaching 15 billion
this is um it's crippling the entire
state and we see at this point that
Illinois they're in a huge amount of
trouble they're collapsing right in
front of us now the governor well he
decided to do something completely crazy
he agreed to hike the personal income
tax rate to four point nine five percent
from three point seven five percent and
a corporate income tax rate well that
will rise from seven percent from five
point two five percent now is this going
to help the situation well most likely
not we know that like the Chicago
schools well they're not going to get
fixed the hikes will not shore up
pension plans within one month of tax
hikes public unions will ask for more
money and people will leave the state
corporations will start to leave the
sate how do we know this we saw what was
happening in Connecticut where
corporations that okay we can't make it
here anymore we need to leave the taxes
are too high we're out we see in New
Jersey Governor Chris Christie declared
a state of emergency in the state and
announced a partial state government
shutdown and it looks like the same
thing is happening that's happening in
Illinois same thing happening in
Connecticut the same thing will happen
in Maine it looks like the legislators
will they fail to reach an agreement by
the deadline for their budget and right
now police well they're turning away
vehicles and people on bicycles at the
island Beach State Park in Ocean County
it is closed and public workers right
now the governor said don't expect to
get any back pay and we can see that
state by state by state things are
completely breaking down and it take
this a step further well we have a
pension national crisis on our hand
America's pension system as we know we
discussed this before is completely
underfunded and we can see right now
that from all these states Illinois
California
New Jersey Connecticut Massachusetts
Kentucky and eight other states they're
very vulnerable to this pension problem
and there are other states that are
teetering on this problem now this is
not a distant concern it is a concern
that is already having we're already in
the crisis now according to data
supplied by the Federal Reserve pensions
public and private combined we're
roughly 27% underfunded at the end of
last year and when we look at the data
more closely we can see that America's
public pensions they're in a six
trillion dollar abyss I mean it's
absolutely ridiculous now remember these
pension systems they were built upon the
idea that these investments were going
to yield around 7.5 percent annual
returns but because the interest rates
are so low and everything else that's
going on the average public pension plan
returned just 1.5% last year the pension
crisis in America is a silent crisis no
one's really talking about it until it
actually hits and we can see that
Illinois is going to have a problem
Maine is going to have a problem New
Jersey's going to have a problem
California is going to have a problem
kinnetik it's going to have a problem
Massachusetts is going to have a problem
these states are all going to have a
problem and there are many more that are
going to turn up saying yes we also have
a pension problem because as we can see
the economy today is not doing as well
as the corporate media the fed the
government wants us to believe it's
doing it is built on an illusion and the
illusion is slowly cracking it's
disappearing now the Atlanta Fed and the
New York Fed they do their estimates on
GDP and we can see that the Atlanta Fed
and the New York Fed they were
completely separate and apart now it
looks like they're converging and it
looks like the New York Fed they're now
cast remains around
point nine percent the Atlanta Fed their
GDP now well it is dipped to two point
seven percent and looks like both of
these numbers they're coming to a point
where they're huge spread before where
one was at like one point five percent
one was at like three percent well that
spread is now narrowing and we're coming
to a more of a estimate that reflects
what's really going on now remember this
is still manipulated this is still not
the real GDP numbers and even if we meet
at two percent or one point nine percent
or one point seven percent what they do
is they play with the numbers they
revise numbers and we can see this is
what they did to the first quarter they
revised the numbers and they create the
illusion that now the GDP numbers are in
line with what the economy is doing and
again the economy is nowhere near that
three percent we're so far below that
and this is completely manipulated we
need to remember they recalculated the
GDP going back to 1929 they added
research and development and other
things and they recalculate it all the
way up to the present time they also
included Obamacare the Obamacare tax
anything that they can throw in there to
make the numbers better this is what
they did and then they go back and they
revise the numbers to make it look like
it's a lot better than it really is
but what we see the Fed doing what we
see the corporate media doing right now
they're building the case to convince us
on one hand that the economy is fine
this is what the Fed does they tell us
that there's you know no recession
headed our way there's no collapse
headed our way we're not going to see a
crisis in our lifetime this is what they
said back in 2008 they were not
forecasting any type of recession Janet
Yellen today said she doesn't predict
any type of crisis within our lifetime
so we can see this is what the Fed does
they pretend they keep us in this
illusion that everything is fine then we
have the corporate media where part of
the corporate media they're on track to
say that you know because of Trump's
policies and what he's doing the economy
looks like it's lip
it's not doing as well and I see in time
they're talking about climate change and
they're saying how climate changes we
backed out of the climate Accord this
could spark another great recession I
mean think about what they're saying
right now they're grasping at anything
they possibly can to convince us of why
this economy is going to fall apart we
know why it's going to fall apart it's
built on an illusion it's built on one
gigantic manipulation think about what
the corporate media did back when retail
wasn't doing well and everyone believed
it except us I mean just think back to
those times after the holiday season
like in January February where they said
well people didn't go to the
brick-and-mortar stores because it was
snowy it was rainy it was icy and of
course this was only happening in one

everyone that retail wasn't doing well
the holiday season wasn't doing well
because it was either too warm or it was

brick-and-mortar stores and combine them
sales were not really up because if
everyone was switching from
brick-and-mortar to online the entire
retail industry should be incredible not
happening all that fell apart now
they're trying to make the excuse of why
the economy's going to be falling apart
and they're saying well it's because of
that policy it's because of the cuts in
government well it's because climate
change they're trying to create a
narrative of why this economy is going
to fall apart this is what we're seeing

we've been tracking this we know exactly
what is happening we know what the Fed

that QE
has been

the only thing they can show us is the
stock market
the Nasdaq and everything else on how

it will not make any sense so get
